title: Georgia House 2026 - Day 3 AM Session 1
summary:
Here is a summary of the Georgia House 2026 - Day 3 AM Session 1 in structured markdown format:

## Overview
This session focused on opening remarks and a scripture reading and prayer from the House chaplain, Rev. Benny Tate. There were no significant legislative actions taken.

## Key Actions
None detected.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None detected.

## Notable Moments
- Rep. Clint Crowe introduced Rev. Benny Tate, the House chaplain for the past 36 years, and shared a personal story about Rev. Tate's ministry to Crowe's family.
- Rev. Tate gave a sermon emphasizing the importance of encouragement, noting that "if they're breathing, they need encouragement."

## Votes
No recorded votes.

## Attendance
Quorum present, as members responded to the morning roll call.

## Adjournment
The session adjourned. No information provided on the next session date.
